results.title: Visit to the Tulip Farm
results.creator_credit: John Barnett and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Produced in partnership with Arts Access and supported by the Department of Human Services and the Deafness Foundation for the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop ‘Telling Tales’. John recounts the highlights of visiting a tulip farm in Silvan and other places.

results.title: Going to my mum's house
results.creator_credit: Debbie Lissek and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Produced in partnership with Arts Access and supported by the Department of Human Services and the Deafness Foundation for the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop ‘Telling Tales’. Debbie lives in a hostel, but spends weekends at her mum’s house. In this story, Debbie gives an outline of the activities she and her mum routinely enjoy on the weekends.

results.title: Going to Nan & Pop's Farm
results.creator_credit: Candice Jones and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Produced in partnership with Arts Access and supported by the Department of Human Services and the Deafness Foundation for the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop ‘Telling Tales’. Candice recounts the fond memories of visiting her grandparents’ flower farm. This story is told with animated illustrations, photographs and video footage.

results.title: The Impact
results.creator_credit: Ross Onley-Zerkel and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Produced in partnership with Arts Access and supported by the Department of Human Services and the Deafness Foundation for the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop ‘Telling Tales’. Ross tells of the traumatic experience of being the victim of a drink driving car crash and the repercussions that event has had on his life thereafter.

results.title: Why?
results.creator_credit: Tehree Gordon and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: A digital story made as part of the ‘Diversity @ Work’ Program in association with AMES, Australia Post and SBS. Tehree says she is an ordinary Australian, though she was a recipient of the Senior Australian of the Year Award in 2004. In this story, Tehree talks about her passion for wildlife from an early age leading to her founding Jirrahlinga Koala and Wildlife Sanctuary with her partner Hamish. The sanctuary has provided work opportunities and enrichment to people living with disabilities and the elderly.

results.title: To do or not to do.....
results.creator_credit: Jock Noble and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: A digital story made as part of the ‘Diversity @ Work’ Program in association with AMES, Australia Post and SBS. Jock Noble, CEO of Diversity@work Australia, talks about the impact having Polio had on his childhood and how that has subsequently shaped his career in helping companies to strengthen through diversity in their workforce.

results.title: My Banquet...
results.creator_credit: Chey Scovell and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: A digital story made as part of the ‘Diversity @ Work’ Program in association with AMES, Australia Post and SBS. Chey Scovell recounts his childhood growing up as an Australian born in Malaysia and the last four years of schooling spent in Papua New Guinea. He tells of the culture shock he experienced when returning back to Australia.

results.title: Doors Will Open
results.creator_credit: Rajani Shrestha and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: A digital story made as part of the ‘Diversity @ Work’ Program in association with AMES, Australia Post and SBS. Rajani Shrestha moved to Melbourne from Nepal in 1992 with her husband and son. Rajani recounts the struggle she faced to find meaningful work in a new country. She tells of her journey which eventually led to her working at AMES Australia.

results.title: My Life with Epilepsy
results.brief_description: Produced in partnership with Arts Access and supported by the Department of Human Services and the Deafness Foundation for the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop ‘Telling Tales’. Jodi tells of her family history with epilepsy and her personal journey as the condition began to affect her life.
